bestBHT.bht: Speaking against the Son of Man may be forgiven, but the sin of blaspheming against the Holy Ghost will not be pardoned. This sin involves rejecting and resisting the power of the Spirit of Pentecost. It is crucial to note that this unpardonable sin is separate from the charge made in Judea and is given immediately after the accusation that Jesus was in league with Beelzebub. The use of the word against in this context is significant, emphasizing the opposition to the Holy Ghost.

Marvin Vincent: A word against the poor and humble Son of Man might... have proceeded from a sincerely pious Jew, under the influence of his early education, which taught him to regard Jesus as an enthusiast or even as an impostor.
The sin of the Jews was in rejecting and resisting the power of the Spirit of Pentecost.
Pardon was offered them there for the sin of crucifying the Lord.
Philip Schaff: Luke 12:10. See on Matthew 12:31, in regard to the sin against the Holy Spirit.
Archibald T. Robertson: This unpardonable sin is given by Mark 3:28; Matthew 12:31 immediately after the charge that Jesus was in league with Beelzebub.
Luke here separates it from the same charge made in Judea (Luke 11:15-20).
Note the use of εις here in the sense of 'against'.
John Gill: And whosoever shall speak a word against the son of man, it shall be forgiven him...
...but unto him that blasphemeth against the Holy Ghost... it shall not be forgiven.
The Ethiopic version adds at the close of this verse, as in Matthew, 'neither in this world, nor in that which is to come'.
John Wesley: Yet the denying me in some degree, may, upon true repentance, be forgiven
If it rise so high as that of the blasphemy against the Holy Ghost, it shall never be forgiven
Neither is there place for repentance

bhtAttempts.bht: It is said that speaking against the Son of Man may be forgiven, but blaspheming against the Holy Ghost will not be forgiven. The unpardonable sin consists of rejecting and resisting the power of the Spirit of Pentecost. This sin is separate from the charge made in Judea, and is given immediately after the accusation that Jesus was in league with Beelzebub. It is important to note the use of against in this context.
